snippet: Even with the partial federal shutdown, new-car sales in October were up 10.6 percent as the industry stayed on track for its best sales in six years.
abstract: Automakers report that new-car sales rose 10.6 percent in October, despite slowdown related to partial federal shutdown, helping the industry stay on track for its best sales in six years.
lead_paragraph: Even with the partial federal shutdown, new-car sales in October were up 10.6 percent as the industry stayed on track for its best sales in six years.

headline.main: Big Gains for Auto Sales Despite a Government Pothole
headline.print_headline: Big Gains for Auto Sales Despite a Government Pothole
